child_best_identifier___1.Description: Participant is best identified as Deaf

child_best_identifier___2.Description: Participant is best identified as hard-of-hearing

child_best_identifier___3.Description: Participant is best identified as hearing (e.g. no diagnosed or significant hearing loss)

child_best_identifier___4.Description: Participant is best identified with a category not listed

eng_access.Description: If your child uses English, at what age, did your child first have access to this language?

Levels.9: My child does not use English

nicu_stay.Description: At birth, was your child admitted into neonatal intensive care?

head_injury.Description: Has your child ever experienced a head injury requiring emergency medical evaluation?

premature.Description: Was your child premature at birth?

child_meds.Description: Does your child currently take any prescribed medications?

child_vision.Description: Which of the statements below best describe your child's vision?

Levels.1: My child does not need glasses or contact lenses for normal vision.
Levels.2: With glasses or contact lenses, my child's vision is corrected to normal levels.
Levels.3: With glasses or contact lenses, my child's vision is still below normal levels.

eye_wear.Description: Does your child prefer to use glasses or contacts?

type_of_corrective_lenses.Description: Describe the type of corrective lenses your child uses.

Levels.1: Far Sighted (needs for reading and focusing on close distances)
Levels.2: Near Sighted (needs for focusing on objects at far distances)

neuro_disease.Description: Does your child have a neurological disease or epilepsy? If yes, please describe the type of neurological disease or epilepsy, and when it was first identified.
